intro: Minuartia macrantha, commonly known as the clustered rock-cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically forms dense mats on rocky soils, thriving in harsh, cold environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Minuartia macrantha is well adapted to extreme conditions, making it a hardy species found in high-altitude and polar regions.
